column5: The course has been specifically designed to advance the skills of registered nurses who work within a general practice setting.The curriculum reflects the changing nature of the health and social care systems and supports the development of skills in interprofessional and multi-organisational working.This course will equip you with the complex and specialised knowledge and skills required to plan, deliver and evaluate excellent person-centered care within the community setting.With a number of pathways and optional modules to choose from, the course offers you the flexibility to adapt your learning based upon your own individual needs.Studying with students from other pathways will help develop your skills in multidisciplinary team working.
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
column9: 2 years Full-time; up to 18 months Part-time
